snippet: In “The Contender,” Michael Shnayerson describes Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo’s youth in Queens, his father’s campaigns, his high-profile marriage and his political future.
abstract: Book The Contender, Michael Shnayerson's new unauthorized biography of New York Gov Andrew M Cuomo, casts its subject as control-obsessed politician with little tolerance for criticism or retail politics; portrayal contradicts largely positive narrative established by Cuomo in autobiography All Things Possible.
lead_paragraph: In “The Contender,” Michael Shnayerson describes Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo’s youth in Queens, his father’s campaigns, his high-profile marriage and his political future.

headline.main: Cuomo Is Called Controlling but a ‘Contender’ in an Unauthorized Biography
headline.print_headline: Book Portrays Cuomo as Brilliant but Controlling

keywords.name: creative_works
keywords.value: The Contender: Andrew Cuomo, a Biography (Book)
